conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the suitcase to find the coefficient of friction (μ) and the angle (θ).
The image shows a suitcase which can be pushed or pulled on the ground.
Gravitational acceleration is given as g = 10 m/s², and sin 37° = 0.6.
The resistance of the suitcase to the ground is proportional to the supporting force of the ground, with the ratio being μ.
The suitcase has a total mass of 15 kg.
Calculate gravitational force: W = mg = 150 N (downward).
Pull force F = 90 N at an angle θ.
Identify normal force (N) acts perpendicular to the ground.
Identify frictional force (f) acts opposite to the direction of motion.
Resolve horizontal component of pull force: F_x = F cos(θ).
Resolve vertical component of pull force: F_y = F sin(θ).
Vertical equilibrium: N + F_y = W, leading to N = 150 - 90 sin(θ).
Horizontal equilibrium: F_x = f, leading to 90 cos(θ) = μ N.
Frictional force relation: 90 cos(θ) = μ (150 - 90 sin(θ)).
Use given trigonometric values: sin(37°) = 0.6, cos(37°) = 0.8.
Assume θ = 37° and solve: 90 cos(37°) = μ (150 - 90 sin(37°)).
Calculate: 72 = μ × 96.
Solve for μ: μ = 72/96 = 0.75.
Conclusion: Coefficient of friction (μ) is 0.75 and angle (θ) is 37°.
